title: These Protein Hair Treatments Brought My Bleach-Damaged Locks Back to Life
description: Transform your tresses from lackluster to luminous.

html:
Best Overall

K18 K18 Leave-In Hair Repair Mask

Pros

  • Repairs extreme damage

Cons

  • Small amount of product

K18 is a cult-favorite for a reason—even Hamilton is obsessed with the Leave-In Molecular Repair Hair Mask. “Rebuilding both polypeptide chains and disulfide bonds, it strengthens hair inside and out, and revives even the most damaged hair from the core—restoring elasticity, smoothness, and bounce,” he says. “Results are visible from the first use, with lasting protection that extends beyond your next wash. The leave-in formula is easy to apply, great for all hair types, and works in just four minutes!”

Size: 1.7 oz

Key ingredients: Patented K18Peptide

Amazon rating: 4.3/5

An ELLE editor says: ”I've been bleaching (and re-dyeing) my hair for years, and this mask saved my brittle locks during my dreadful blonde phase. After just one use, I could feel my hair becoming shinier and stronger. Over time, my bleach-damaged hair had never felt healthier. The best part? You only have to sit in it for four minutes!”—Emma Aerin Becker, associate beauty e-commerce editor

Best for Split Ends

Briogeo Don't Despair Repair Rice Water Protein + Moisture Strengthening Treatment

Pros

  • Additional oils make hair super shiny

For at-home hair care, this protein treatment is pretty intense. It strikes a nice balance between a complex combination of proteins, biotin, and nourishing oils for added hydration and strength. It helps repair but also protects against future stressors.

Size: 5 0z.

Key ingredients: Rice protein complex, vitamin B, algae etract

Nordstrom rating: 4.7/5 stars

A Nordstrom reviewer says: “I have been looking for a product to repair my damaged wavy hair and within 2 uses I feel like my hair is as healthy as it used to be before I started heat styling my hair.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best Value

Elizavecca Cer-100 Collagen Coating Hair Protein Treatment

Now 20% Off

Pros

  • Good price
  • A little goes a long way
  • Fast-acting

Cons

  • Some reviewers do not like the smell

This under-$10 protein treatment has over 49,000 near-perfect reviews on Amazon, proving that healthy hair does not have to break the bank. It contains ceramides, collagen, and keratin that will transform your hair in just five minutes.

Size: 3.38 oz.

Key ingredients: Collagen, cer-100, keratin

Amazon rating: 4.4/5 stars

An Amazon reviewer says: “It is an amazing hair mask that makes my hair SO soft and smooth. It is highly protein-based, so I would not recommend using it all the time, but it makes for a great mask every other week or so. A little goes a long way, and you can feel immediately the impact it has on your hair. I can especially tell the difference when I use this after I bleach my hair, it really brings it back to life! I think it is a great value and I will continue to repurchase.”

Best for Fine to Medium Hair

Ouai Treatment Mask for Fine and Medium Hair

Cons

  • Not for thick hair
  • Pricey

Specifically made to treat fine to medium brittle hair, this protein treatment acts as a mask that helps restore hydration, repair damage, and add shine. The extra-strength protein prevents breakage and leaves your hair looking healthy and smelling good. Plus, it features Ouai’s signature scent Melrose Place, a rose fragrance with hints of bergamot, lychee, cedarwood, and musk.

Size: 8 oz.

Key ingredients: Shea butter, keratin, panthenol

Amazon rating: 4.5/5 stars

An Amazon reviewer says: “This hair mask is like no other. I have been growing my hair out and I have curly hair, when I leave this in for 15 minutes my hair is so soft and straight for like four days the smell is amazing it makes your hair so so so soft, I am on my fourth jar!!”

Best for Heat Damage

Valmont Recovering Mask

Pros

  • Active ingredients for long-term benefits

Cons

  • No written customer reviews

“This mask is an instant rescue remedy for hair that’s seen too many blowouts, color treatments, and heat tools,” says Hamilton. “The keratin and anti-glycation complex smooth every strand, leaving the hair glossy while rebuilding the cuticle from within. Ceramides mimic the hair’s natural barrier, adding volume and shine without weighing it down.”

Size: 6.8 oz

Key ingredients: Keratin and anti-glycation complex, triple DNA, ceramides

Neiman Marcus rating: 5/5

Best Luxe

Oribe Gold Lust Transformative Masque

Cons

  • Will have to re-up often

Once you read about all the nutrient-rich ingredients this creamy hair mask contains, it will justify the price point. Formulated with biotin, collagen, caffeine, niacinamide—plus vitamins A, D, E, and F through baobab tree oil—you get a hard-working treatment that penetrates the cuticle to transform your mane. It instantly restores softness, shine, and body to dry, overworked, and chemically-treated hair while working long-term to defend against future damage.

Size: 5 oz.

Key ingredients: Biotin, plant collagen, caffeine, and niacinamide, baobab tree oil

Amazon rating: 4.5/5 stars

An Amazon reviewer says: “This truly exceeded my expectations. This is lightweight and doesn’t weigh my hair down. This also has a pleasant scent that lingers throughout the day. It may be a bit pricier than other options, but the results are definitely worth the investment.”

Best for Shine

Glaze GlaziPlex Super Bond Repair Treatment

Pros

  • Helps enhance color
  • Multitasking treatment
  • Clean ingredients

Cons

  • Some reviewers say it does not help tame frizz

Known as QuadBond technology, this four-in-one hair treatment repairs heat, chemical, color, and styling damage in just four minutes. It gives a glossy, salon-like finish while working inside the cuticles to strengthen and repair for long-term health, hydration, and growth.

Size: 6.4 oz.

Key ingredients: Protein complex of 11-hair-fortifying amino acids and hydrolyzed protein, hyaluronic acid, castor oil

Amazon rating: 3.9/5 stars

An Amazon reviewer says: “This product is fantastic. My hair is long and the ends were extremely dry and scraggly. After the first use of this product it already feels so much better. It also smells divine! Would definitely recommend!”

Best for Daily Use

Virtue Restorative Treatment Hair Mask

Pros

  • A little goes a long way
  • Lightweight

Doram uses Virtue’s Restorative Treatment Hair Mask every day as a conditioner. “This has a natural keratin base. Plus, it is very light and gentle to the hair and does not weigh it down. It also leaves my hair bouncy and full.” This mask actively rehabilitates all hair types, infusing shine, moisture, and strength. The formula contains a plant-based protein that boosts color, induces moisture retention, and adds a glossy shine through antioxidants.

Size: 1.7 oz.

Key ingredients: Alpha keratin 60ku, brown algae extract, amaranthus caudatus seed, baobab seed oil, artichoke leaf extract

Amazon rating: 4.3/5 stars

An Amazon reviewer says: “My hair is fine and gets frizzy after wash. I have tried so many hair masks that claim to make your hair not frizzy, and soft and manageable, but nothing works, other than this mask. I love how it makes my hair soft, healthier and more manageable. Just five minutes of this mask creates magic!”

Best Curly Hair

Curlsmith Feather-Light Protein Cream

Pros

  • Reviewers say curls last for days
  • Enhances curls
  • Non-greasy

Cons

  • Some reviewers do not like the scent

Curlsmith’s protein-enriched styler combines the moisture of a cream with the flexible hold technology of a gel. It provides a silky smooth finish while taming frizz, protecting from heat, and rebuilding strength. This product works best for medium to thick hair.

Size: 8 oz.

Key ingredients: Brown algae, amaranthus caudatus seed extract, baobab seed oil, ipha keratin 60ku

Amazon rating: 4.6/5 stars

An Amazon reviewer says: “I have another hair styling product from Curlsmith but it’s a 1 on the hold scale. I was looking for a little more hold for those humid days, but not too much. I like my hair to look soft. My curls are spiral-like, but my hair texture is fine, so too much hold doesn’t look natural. This product not only gives my hair extra curls, but it stays looking soft. The smell is the best part though! It’s sort of fruity and citrus, but very light. The consistency is like a cream, but a little bit liquid. I am glad to have found this product!”

Best for All Hair Types

Olaplex Hair Perfector No. 3

Pros

  • Protects hair structure and reduces breakage

Cons

  • Best if used 1-3 times a week

Made for all hair types, Hamilton is a huge fan of the Olaplex Hair Perfector No. 3. “This pre-shampoo treatment rebuilds all three hair bonds, strengthening hair after just a single use, and helping to prevent future breakage,” Hamilton explains. Simply apply to damp hair and let it sit for at least 10 minutes before rinsing.

Size: 3.3 oz

Key ingredients: Bis-Aminopropyl Diglycol Dimaleate

Nordstrom rating: 4.4/5

A Nordstrom reviewer says: “I cannot say enough great things about this product. My hair is very processed from bleaching over the years and after just a few uses, this has restored so much softness to my ends. I pop this in my hair and will do some errands before washing it out. I've let it sit anywhere from 30 minutes to over an hour. I have tried so many products to bring life back into my hair and this finally did the trick.”

Protein Treatment Precautions

It’s important to choose a protein treatment that matches your hair type and specific needs to avoid overloading your hair with protein, which can cause brittleness. Hair expert and co-founder of IGK Hair Care, Aaron Grenia, says, “Fine or oily hair might need lighter formulations to avoid weighing the hair down, while thicker or curly hair can benefit from richer treatments that provide more intensive repair.”

Protein treatments should also be used in moderation. “Overuse can lead to an excess of protein in the hair, causing it to become stiff and prone to breakage. Always follow the product’s instructions and pay attention to how your hair responds to find the perfect balance,” he adds.

What to look for in a protein hair treatment

When choosing a protein hair treatment, Hamilton says it's most important to “find salon-grade or professional-level products that have proven efficacy and are tailored to your specific hair type and needs.” In many of these formulas, you'll find high-quality proteins and amino acids—the key to an effective protein treatment. And to avoid making the hair too soft and brittle, “seek out treatments that are balanced with moisture,” Hamilton concludes.
